Aggregation and scaling

Functions for aggregating and scaling hierarchical data

agg() scale()

Aggregate/Scale a detailed level of a hierarchical variable to an aggregate level

Debugging aggregation and scaling

Functions for debugging errors/warnings when aggregating and scaling hierarchical data

agg() scale()

Aggregate/Scale a detailed level of a hierarchical variable to an aggregate level

agg_subtree() scale_subtree()

Aggregate or scale one subtree's children values to the parent level

Check inputs to agg and scale functions

check_agg_scale_subtree_dt()

Check subtree data.table before aggregation and scaling

collapse_common_intervals()

Collapse an interval variable to the most detailed common set of intervals

collapse_tree()

Collapse the data.tree so that intermediate nodes without data are removed

create_base_tree()

Create a data.tree object using a mapping of levels of a categorical or interval variable

create_interval_node()

Create a node for an interval tree

create_agg_interval_tree() create_scale_interval_tree()

Create a data.tree object to be used for aggregating or scaling interval data

create_agg_subtrees() create_scale_subtrees()

Create a list of subtrees that can be used during aggregation or scaling

create_agg_tree() create_scale_tree() vis_tree()

Create a data.tree object to be used for aggregating or scaling hierarchical categorical or interval data

fill_missing_intervals()

create new interval nodes for any missing interval nodes

Generate columns to help describe numeric variable intervals
